DOC.brief_summary: The relationship between cytomegalovirus infection and recurrence of hepatitis C in liver transplant recipients remains controversial. Although some studies (Teixeira et al., 2000; Singh et al., 2005)have not found an association between recurrence of hepatitis C and CMV infection, studies such as Rosen et al. show that 50% of patients with CMV infection suffered cirrhosis durig follow-up period, while between not-infected patients the rate was 11%. To clarify this question, a non-interventional study will be carried out in order to assess if CMV replication is a risk factor for graft dysfunction in liver transplant recipients.
DOC.brief_title: Impact of Cytomegalovirus (CMV) Replication Over Hepatitis C Recurrence in Liver Transplant Recipients
DOC.criteria: Men or women who underwent liver transplantation after hepatopathy caused by HCV, confirmed by pretransplantation detection of HCV RNA Age > 18 years old Patients coinfected with HBV or HIV Patients who show other causes of liver disease
DOC.keyword: Patients who underwent first liver transplantation due to hepatopathy caused by HCV,confirmed by detection of HCV RNA previously to transplantation
